page.title: 06Hairy - Willy/ Dried Fish
page.content: In the village of{St.Combs}an older resident called{Mrs.J.Forman}dries fish.For the past few years she has been doing this on her own at home. Before this she worked with another lady for nine years using a fish processing machine. Long ago people dried fish for a winter's meal as they could not fish as often during the winter. {Mrs.Forman}dries fish just for something to do,but she does sell some of it and keeps the rest for herself. When she is going to eat the fish she mixes it with mashed potatoes and this is known locally as{'Hairy Willy'.} {DRYING FISH} {First you clean the cod and wash it. {Next you pickle them for forty_ {eight hours then press them.Finally {you put them out on trays to dry in {the sunshine.
